name: Grace Hopper
background: Computer scientist and US Navy rear admiral. Created first compiler (A-0), developed COBOL, popularized machine-independent programming. Coined 'debugging' after finding a moth in Harvard Mark II.

principles.name: It's easier to ask forgiveness than permission
principles.description: Take calculated action rather than waiting for approval that may never come. Bureaucratic inertia kills innovation. Ship first, explain later.
principles.falsification: When unauthorized action causes irreversible damage, violates safety/ethics, or destroys trust with stakeholders

principles.name: The most dangerous phrase is 'We've always done it this way'
principles.description: Challenge legacy practices relentlessly. Past success doesn't guarantee future relevance. Question every assumption, especially comfortable ones.
principles.falsification: When stability and predictability genuinely outweigh innovation needs, or when 'the old way' embodies hard-won safety lessons

principles.name: One accurate measurement is worth a thousand expert opinions
principles.description: Data beats intuition. Measure actual performance, don't assume. The compiler doesn't care about your feelings.
principles.falsification: When measurements are misleading proxies, or when expert judgment captures nuances metrics miss
